Posts.Content: Hi, I too want my 'good' boob removed. I had surgery first and am now half way through chemo. I did askmy surgeon if she would remove my good side and she said yes ifi insisted however she would rather I waited for the to e of recon as it would give me more options. I now regret not pushing for a double mx. I would rather have none than one and even with my prosthesis, which is great, due to my remaining boob being a DD/E my upper chest area is flatter on my mx side than my remaining side, I hadn't really realised how far up my breast tissue went! Anyway, after my RT in February I am hopimg to see my surgeon again and ask her to remove my remaining boob, I'm happy to wait longer for recon but I NEED it gone ASAP! I hate it! Xxx
Posts.Title: Thinking of voluntary MX

Posts.Content: Hi Kelly, I'm so sorry you've found yourself facing this awful situation again. I was diagnosed at 31 and had no strong family history, closest relative to have breast cancer was my great grandmother. I can't offer you any advice or experience on the IVF but wanted to say that it's great they are getting your eggs removed before you start treatment. They'll be ready and waiting for you when you are ready! Are you having any hormonal treatment afterwards which may delay IVF? Best wishes for your treatment, Hayley X P.s. there's a private Facebook page for under 40's with BC, there's about 300 of us on it, if you search for 'younger breast cancer network (uk) secret group' there is probably someone on there who can offer you advice and experience. X
Posts.Title: Breast cancer at a young age- second time

Posts.Content: Hi, I got my wig last week in Aberdeen. Its a judy plum wig called icone in a chocolate mix, I love it and it's very like my own hair style just slightly lighter. The box says £320 and it was completely free. The nhs voucher doesn't include real hair wigs however they are very hard to look after and the synthetic wigs are very good these days.
Posts.Title: WHAT TYPE OF WIG TO CHOOSE???????

Posts.Content: It's really lovely! The fringe bit can be swept over or as a light fringe. My 5 year old daughter said "it's just the same" when I tried it on so I was very happy!
Posts.Title: WHAT TYPE OF WIG TO CHOOSE???????

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne, How are you getting on with wearing your wig? I can totally understand your emotion, I am probably about a month behind you in getting my wig.... Or perhaps sooner, my first chemo is on Thursday. I've known since 26th June that I will be having chemo and have thoroughly researched wigs, had my hair cut shorter at the Toni and guy strength in style programme and talked very openly and positively with friends and family yet I know that come the time to buzz off what hair I have left and wear my wig I will be an emotional wreck. You didn't choose to have to wear a wig and for me the loss of control is a major issue in this battle with cancer. I have always given my all at different stages in life whether it's college, having children, living abroad, decorating a room, anything! But this chapter in my life is like no other, there's no real choices to be made, I have to go with it and I'm really not used to that! I hope you are feeling more settled and enjoying your new look. It's only temporary and just think by next summer we'll be sporting another new look with our own hair... My stylist hoped that by Easter I could have a cute pixie doo! Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: How did you react to getting your wigs?

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne, How are you getting on with wearing your wig? I can totally understand your emotion, I am probably about a month behind you in getting my wig.... Or perhaps sooner, my first chemo is on Thursday. I've known since 26th June that I will be having chemo and have thoroughly researched wigs, had my hair cut shorter at the Toni and guy strength in style programme and talked very openly and positively with friends and family yet I know that come the time to buzz off what hair I have left and wear my wig I will be an emotional wreck. I have always given my all at different stages in life whether it's college, having children, living abroad, decorating a room, anything! It's only temporary and just think by next summer we'll be sporting another new look with our own hair... My stylist hoped that by Easter I could have a cute pixie doo! Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: How did you react to getting your wigs?

Posts.Content: Hi team mates! I had my surgery results today, 18 days post MX and LNC. Pathology has discovered that I had zero lymph node involvement and 6mm margins from the closest cancerous area, I had 4 very small areas. The MRI 'confirmed' that the 2nd lump which could be felt was in the lymph node but that was wrong! I am SO relieved! My cancer was grade 3 so I will still be having chemo, rads, herceptin and tamoxifen. I'm quite happy that I am having chemo, makes me feel like everything possible is being done to put all this behind me, putting the follow ups aside! Chemo should start in 2-3wks, I've to have a muga scan next week. Lots of love xxxx
Posts.Title: Surgery results and very relieved!

Posts.Content: Hi, I had my RT planning about 10 days ago, the CT scan is very quick and is to get the positioning of your heart and lungs so the radiation can be minimised in those areas. You will also get 2 tiny tattoos, one in the middle of your chest and one at the side of your ribs, these are tiny, much smaller than I expected and were painless. These are for the lining up of the machine. Nothing to worry about. Xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy planning

Posts.Content: Hi I'm due to have my second FEC tomorrow and the ward just called to say one of my results are low. It's 0.6 and needs to be 1.5 to go ahead with chemo. I've o go in early tomorrow to test again before deciding if chemo can go ahead or not. I'm really surprised as I feel really well. I presume there's nothing I can do to help?
Posts.Title: Pre chemo blood results are low

Posts.Content: Hi Ankah, You will get a lot of support from this site. I was diagnosed on the 26th June, left mx and LNC (turns out I actually had zero lymph involvement) on 2 August and had my first chemo yesterday. I actually can't believe I am t this stage now Nd once you've had surgery and results I'm sure you'll feel a lot better, Ask away if you've any questions. Xxx
Posts.Title: Newgirl

Posts.Content: Hi, The day before has finally come and I am more scared of the general anaesthetic than what they are actually doing! I'm even quite looking forward to starting chemo afterwards and hope I can fit in all 6 before Christmas... I'd have to start 4 weeks post op to finish in December. My children seem more excited about having sleepovers rather than worried about me going to hospital so that's one less worry. They're 5 and 3 so a bit young to process any more than "I'm having a little operation" my 5 year old didn't even ask why! It's been great reading all your positive stories about your surgery and how the pain afterwards seems fairly minimal. Speak to you all next week when I get back home. Lots of love X
Posts.Title: MX tomorrow and lymph node clearance....

Posts.Content: Congratulations!!!! Hope this cycle is good to you :) xx
Posts.Title: Just had my last Chemo!!

Posts.Content: Hi, I haven't used the cold cap however wanted to reply to you to say why I didn't. I had lovely long thick hair and have had it cut into a bob (my first FEC was 9 days ago). I have a family friend who used the cold cap and regretted it. My main reasons were the fact that even though i would have my own hair i wouldnt be able to style it as i usually do therefore I wouldn't ever be happy with it, it also prolongs your time in the chemo ward and can be extremely uncomfortably cold! I have my wig fitting on Tuesday. Good luck with your decision! X
Posts.Title: A Cold cap - did it work for you?

Posts.Content: YES!!! Please please please do. I dont want to add to your worry but I was diagnosed and the age of 31 in June of this year, small lump found myself at the front top of my breast and another small further lump was discovered after an ultrasound. I was initially sent away for a month to try anti inflammatory cream and evening primrose oil, I went back a month later with no change and was sent up to the hospital, albeit another month later! While on the ward after my surgery I met a 26 year old who had initially found a lump under her arm and was also sent away from her GP several times being told it was nothing to worry about. I think it has to be our age that makes them presume it's not cancer, but it can be. Good luck, I really hope it is nothing but if you go to a breast clinical least they could do a fine needle aspiration and check the cells, they did this on my lumps.
Posts.Title: Second opinion - lump?

Posts.Content: It's great to have a plan isn't it! The waiting is definately the worst part. Keep busy until your surgery date.
Posts.Title: results at last

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm not as young as you but I do see myself as a young breast cancer fighter at 31! There was a 26 year old having surgery the same day as me in my ward so you're not alone. I had my second FEC chemo yesterday and it's not as bad as I was expecting. I think age is on our side regarding side effects. Just make sure you take your anti sickness for the first couple of days, I get domperidone and they are so effective, I've not been sick only felt nauseous but the pills work great. Good luck for tomorrow X
Posts.Title: chemo day 2moro

Posts.Content: Topless!!! Go you! That's brilliant! 4 months ago I would never have believed that I would happily walk around my house in my pj's with clearly only one boob (my remaining right boob is a DD/E.). I've even done it in front of my Dad and brother! Going through cancer treatment is life changing and time absorbing however it doesn't have to rule your life completely. We are all very entitled to have bad days but we have to have good days too, I hope you have self medicated yourself with laughter and treats! It's guaranteed we'll have shit days but for our sanity we have got to have great days and this is where our fabulous friends and family play such an important part, I'm hosting (along with my Mums never ending first class support) the Macmillan worlds biggest coffee morning on the 28th! Xx
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: I'm so chuffed I had to share! My Mum and I organised a coffee morning at my house and we've made £670.50! About 20 of my lovely friends and family came along, enjoyed cakes, tea, coffee and raffles! It was a great day... Our 'morning' went on until about 2pm! Hope you are all fine and managed to have some cake today :) X
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee morning - £670.50!!!

Posts.Content: Topless!!! Go you! That's brilliant! 4 months ago I would never have believed that I would happily walk around my house in my pj's with clearly only one boob (my remaining right boob is a DD/E.). It's guaranteed we'll have shit days but for our sanity we have got to have great days and this is where our fabulous friends and family play such an important part, I'm hosting (along with my Mums never ending first class support) the Macmillan worlds biggest coffee morning on the 28th! Xx
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: How do we post photos? My final total was £705.50! X
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee morning - £670.50!!!

Posts.Content: Loved reading this, made me smile! I've got two appts tomorrow, you win! I'm getting my permanent prosthesis, I can't wait, my softie is too big! And I'm seeing a lymphodema nurse for advice on prevention. Glad your day went well and by the time your chemo day comes round next Tuesday you'll have take everything in and feel ready to start. My husband was surprised at home relaxed I was at my first one (2 weeks ago tomorrow) as I was in such a stressed state pre surgery! Night night X
Posts.Title: "On A Light-Hearted Note ........"

Posts.Content: Hi, Appointments went well, love my new boob and I'm back into underwired bras, feels great :) she also gave me some brochures with lovely and reasonably prices swimwear which I'm pleased about as I really want to be able to swim with my girls again soon. Lymphodema nurse was lovely, she's not concerned about me whatsoever however I am feeling a lot kore confident about prevention and that's what matters at this stge. Did you get a restful day today after yesterday?! X
Posts.Title: "On A Light-Hearted Note ........"

Posts.Content: Thanks! I don't know what type of chemo... Didn't ask that but probably will ask the question when I am n next week. I still haven't told my daughters anything yet, they're 5 and 3, I have the 'mummy's lump' book which I think I might read, at least to my eldest. I don't think I am depressed, to be honest my emotions take a nose dive when my kids do something cute or nice and I start thinking of their futures and my mind goes mad! Or when I see my husband with our girls having fun . I'm fairly sure that once the op is over an the battle has truly commenced I will feel better however I am considering speaking to my GP about counselling. Xxx
Posts.Title: Results today - Invasive ductal breast cancer, ER and stage 2b

Posts.Content: I read this in my local paper today with much interest as I'm due to start herceptin in the new year. If you google 'press and journal breast cancer perjeta' you should find the article. More research is to be done but it's great to hear about advances in treatment :) Xx
Posts.Title: PERJETA - new drug With potentially better results than herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi, This is my first post although I started blogging not long after I was initially diagnosed on 26th June.... 3 looooong weeks ago tomorrow. I am 31 and I am having a left mastectomy and axillary clearance on the 2nd June. Cannot believe I have this with no family history. I am so so grateful I have such a supportive husband and family and friends desperate to support and help in every way they can. Also feel very lucky to have had my 2 beautiful daughters and not have the stress of fertility decisions before chemo. Does anyone have the same cancer as me - was just curious as to the chemo cocktail than is usually used after surgery? Just curious, I know every case is different. I also have PCOS and although my consultant says its not connected I am struggling to understand how it can't be when it's oestrogen responsive...! I want my ovaries removed at some stage in the near future. Looking forward to getting to know you all in our journeys and seeing us all cross the finish line :) Xxx
Posts.Title: Results today - Invasive ductal breast cancer, ER and stage 2b

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your replies. Feeling positive one minute and in floods of tears the next. I'm petrified yet determined to beat this. It's a week tomorrow until my operation, wish it was tomorrow! I'm strangely looking forward to the chemo, I know there's a good chance it'll be pretty awful but at least I'll be doing something! Lots of love to you all X
Posts.Title: Results today - Invasive ductal breast cancer, ER and stage 2b

Posts.Content: I now use Biosen deodorant, it's both paraben and aluminium free. Beware though as the Biosen body wash is NOT paraben free! X
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Morning team mates! Have many of you changed to paraben free cosmetics? I already used bare minerals make up which is paraben free however I have changed my face wash, creams, body wash and body cream to Origins. The lady at their counter in John lewis was so helpful and not on a big sell. Just curious if I'm in the majority of the anti parabens! I know there's no proven link however there are studies which have shown that most breast cancers contain parabens, I'm willing to do anything to help! I was amazed to discover that brands such as Simple, body shop, Liz Earl etc contained parabens!!!
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Wow there really is a demand for all natural isn't there! I must say despite all the reading I've done online it's still very confusing, shame the ingredient names are so long to remember! I'm wanting to wear dark ail varnish but cautious about having it on all the time and ave noticed my nail varnish remover contains parabens! Good grief, it's everywhere!!! Any nail varnish brands that are good for us to use??? I've ordered Suncoat nail varnish remover however the actual nail varnishes all seem to have something in them that we 'shouldnt' use, argh! X
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Hi, Had to come back on this post and report my findings!!! I received the natural aqueous cream from Shea by nature, it's lovely and does feel so much nicer than what I got on prescription. Think I was about £12 for a tub but it will last months! I also ordered some ZOYA nail varnishes - Zoya nail polishes are FREE of formaldehyde, Toluene, Dibutyl Phthalate, Camphor and Vegan Friendy, AND they apparently last on natural nails up to seven/ten days! I've only had mine on for 3 days but I can honestly say there is not one chip yet and I would have always had some chips by now from no7 or rimmel! Xx
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Hi, I had a left mx and LNC on 2nd Aug, just over 5 weeks ago. My breast nurse advised me to get a front fastening bra and I'm so glad I did, my shoulder was quite stiff initially and with the drains also coming out right where a bra sits I had a bit more control over where it was placed! I found a post surgery bra made my Anita online - Anita does a lot of mastectomy bras. My drains were the painful part for me, the stitch which held them in seemed very tight and if I twisted the wrong way the pain was incredible albeit just for a few seconds. I had absolutely no bruising and my scar is incredibly neat. I had google imaged mastectomies so I knew what to expect. My first drain was removed on day 3 and my second was day 7. The hospital gave us a bag to carry the drains in however once I was home I used one of my own! I was first to theatre on the Thursday however I styed in hospital until the Saturday morning. I was pretty knackered until Friday lunchtime and as I have 2 small kids at home I thought a second night was of benefit to my recovery... I was desperate to et it by the saturday though! Best of luck, I'm sure you'll be fine. Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: impending masectomy

Posts.Content: Hi, How annoying of the senior sister to say things like that to you, that's jut fuel to the fire of the already awful worry we have while waiting on results. you'd think she'd know better! I know it's easier said than done but please try to limit the worrying (and googling!) until you actually have actual facts from your results. I was initially told that one of my two small lumps was an auxiliary node, I was devastated and when results dy post surgery (mx and LNC) was approaching I was beside myself with dread about how many lymph nodes were involved.... Turns out NONE! Pathology came back with clear margins and no lymph involvement, I was so relieved but also very upset that for weeks I had believed it had spread outwith my breast tissue. Nothing is certain until after surgery. Some lumps are bigger and some are actually smaller. Good luck on Friday, the biopsys are unpleasant but bearable. Mine were done in mammography, you'll be well looked after I'm sure. Xxx
Posts.Title: Biopsy results inconclusive now double biopsy this Friday

Posts.Content: Hi, Incase any of you don't know about this, it's great! Wanted to come on and tell you about this. I thought the whole experience was great. I was kept fairly private with my stylist who was lovely and at no point did I feel rushed into decision making. I had long dark thick hair and now have a choppy bob until it comes out :( I can take my wig in and it will be personalised free of charge and my stylist also said he would buzz my head when I've decided the time has come for it all to go - I plan to get my husband to do this but thought e offer was nice and he said they have a private room for that. Xxx
Posts.Title: Strength in Style at Toni and Guy

Posts.Content: This made me laugh as I said this to my husband a few weeks ago and he gave me a funny look!!! I said its as if not having my boob there means there's less insulation...?! Xx
Posts.Title: A bit of a weird one.....
